item.title: Pauline add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Pauline add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "To be ignorant of what occurred before you were born is to remain always a child. For what is the worth of human life, unless it is woven into the life of our ancestors by the records of history?" -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Pauline add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "Laws are silent in times of war." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Pauline add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "What is morally wrong can never be advantageous, even when it enables you to make some gain that you believe to be to your advantage. The mere act of believing that some wrongful course of action constitutes an advantage is pernicious." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Pauline add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description:
"Non nobis solum nati sumus.
(Not for ourselves alone are we born.)" -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Pauline add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "It is a great thing to know your vices." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Pauline add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Pauline add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I sincerely believe that banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies, and that the principle of spending money to be paid by posterity, under the name of funding, is but swindling futurity on a large scale." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Pauline add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "If you can walk with the crowd and keep your virtue, or walk with Kings-nor lose the common touch; If neither foes nor loving friends can hurt you; If all men count with you, but none too much; If you can fill the unforgiving minute with 60 seconds worth of distance run- Yours is the earth and everything that's in it, And-which is more-you'll be a man my son." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Pauline add a quote by George S. Patton Jr.
item.description: "It is foolish and wrong to mourn the men who died. Rather, we should thank God that such men lived." -- George S. Patton Jr.

item.title: Pauline add a quote by James Madison
item.description: "The means of defence agst. foreign danger, have been always the instruments of tyranny at home." -- James Madison

item.title: Pauline add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Freedom is often the first casualty of war." -- Gabriel García Márquez
